content:
Chicken Embryonic Blood Cells
1. Collect blood into 1X Earl's Balanced Salts
Wash 2X by spinning cells in clinical centrifuge 2' full speed and
aspirating off the supernatant
2. Homogenize in 60-80X of Guanidinium lsothiocyanate by vortexing
very hard. If viscosity doesn't go down, dounce homogenize
5M Guanadium lsothiocyanate
50 mM Tris pH 7.5 
50 mM EDTA pH 8.0 Filter through .45 micron
3% Sarkosyl cellulose nitrate filter
5% [3-mercaptoethanol
3. Layer over a cesium cushion 5.7 Cesium chloride
Spin overnight 1 mM EDTA pH 8.0
filter through .45 micron

Aspirate off supernatant being careful to leave the pellet
Resuspend the pellet in sterile water
Add Na Acetate to 0.3 
Add 2 volumes Ethanol and precipitate
5. Measure OD250 of the RNA. 1.0 OD 50 ug/ml
Store the RNA at as Ethanol precipitate
protection with Vimentin probe
